member.name: T:ConstTypeArgs.Delegates.Funcs.Function`2
member.summary:
The class provides an argument provider that wraps the
System.Func<TResult> value from another argument provider.
member.typeparam: The type of output.
The type of argument provider containing the value to wrap.
member.remarks: This class can be useful when creating domain-specific argument providers, such as default values, when an argument provider's value needs to be wrapped for use in a different context.

The const type argument provides a predicate that performs a logical AND operation on the Predicate<T> const type argument and the given input of the type , and provides the static method evaluating against a given const type argument of type .
The input's type.
The predicate const type argument to evaluate.
The following table shows the result of the AND operation for all possible inputs:
A B A AND B
false false false
false true false
true false false
true true true

| A | B | A IMPLY B | |-------|-------|-----------| | false | false | true | | false | true | true | | true | false | false | | true | true | true | *
The const type argument provides a predicate that performs a logical IMPLY operation on the Predicate<T> const type arguments and given input of the type and provides the static method to evaluate against a given const type argument of type . IMPLY is also known as "material implication" or "material conditional".
The input's type.
The 1st predicate const type argument to evaluate.
The 2nd predicate const type argument to evaluate.
returns only if a true premise () does not lead to a false conclusion (). & return the same value.
The following table shows the result of the IMPLY operation for all possible inputs:
A B A IMPLY B
false false true
false true true
true false false
true true true

NIMPLY is also known as "non-implication" or "antecedent".
The input's type.
The 1st predicate const type argument to evaluate.
The 2nd predicate const type argument to evaluate.
returns only if a true premise () leads to a false conclusion ().

A B A NIMPLY B
